metadata.title: CVE-2018-18344 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Inappropriate allowance of the setDownloadBehavior devtools protocolfeature in Extensions in Google Chrome prior to 71.0.3578.80 allowed aremote attacker with control of an installed extension to access files onthe local file system via a crafted Chrome Extension.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18344` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '71.0.3578.80-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
